comment: Professor Beeks was excellent. Very knowledgeable and kept the class engaged in lectures. I applaud Kennesaw State for having professors like him teaching there. I would take him again and recommend the same for anyone else.

DO NOT take this class if your intent is to learn anything.Weekly postings, one PP presentation and two papers. Professor provides little to no feedback on weekly postings, grades are only posted for bibliographies and essays.

At first, everything was ridiculously disorganized. He allows students to make up discussion questions upon approval. He gives very little feedback on discussion questions and only posts grades in accordance to the annotated bibliographies and research papers.

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS! He is not clear about anything, does not respond to questions until after due dates, give little or no feedback, and does not really teach. This is an online course and he has students read a chapter or 2 a wk then discuss it. Everything I've learned, I have taught myself. I know my classmates feel the same.

Taken Prof. Beeks online classes twice.  Found his grading to be fair and assignments relevant. His online instructions tend to be somewhat difficult to follow, but not impossible. Overall I felt his courses were valuable.

WORST prof I had at KSU, I graduated with a degree in business and come back for my educ degree - he was horrible.  Nothing clear about his directions at all but expected you to follow them to a T.  I withdrew b/c I didnt want to get a poor grade.  He was so unpredictible I couldnt risk it. Bad, bad, bad!

I knew I was in trouble when the syllabus had 22 spelling errors and had assignment due dates from mid 2008. How do you teach an online class with no plan? Why assign papers to be written in APA format of course! Let's not forget the snoozer British textbook that is assigned.

Useless. Does not give tests back. Never covers the material in class. You will have to read the book in order to get a good grade. 2 essays that he grades rather harshly. Rambles too much about things that have nothing to do with the class. Not really available to get help from. Overall, wouldn't talk him again.

Prof. Beeks is a nice man, but he does not actully teach the subject and his lectures do not go over the material in the book.  He spends a lot of time talking about personal experiences and does not explain the subject.  There are 2 essays that need to be very well researched.  He does grade SOME assignments on a curve.  Attend all classes and par
Great discussions but he doesn't actually teach the subject.

Prof. Beeks is a nice man, but attendance is mandatory and he doesn't really go over the material you will be tested on during class. You will have to use the book a lot to study for test and to make a good grade. He has you write 2 papers which are involved. Somehow I got an A on the 2nd test which I did not study for and I know I missed more.

Online World Regional Geo class very intersting, learned more than I ever expected.  Take this class along w/the Contemp Intl'Politics (online)as they seem to relate.  Test material comes straight from material in text. great class
He was very entertaining when I took his class in 2005. If you are taking the class to learn, do not take his class.  He does not go over any of the test, but he does curve the grades.

attendance and class participation is a must.  first test is a multiple choice with info found deep inside the textbook - grades this on a curve.  second test is essay, 4 topics 2 pages each.  all about thesis statement and appropriate sources.  doesn't really teach, talks alot about personal stuff.

Prof. Beeks goes off on tangents constanlty and never truly teaches. He does not test over what he covers in class and the test are ridiculous! It was a total waste of my time and money. I almost want to take it over with another professor just so I can get something out of it.
he loves to talk, unfortunately on everything but geography. he does not prepare you for the test at all. very disorganized.

Pulls alot of your grade based on class participation by just being seen in class.  Not out of nowhere.  Very entertaining teacher...likes teaching about the social side of geography.  1 short team presentation required.

OMG!! PUlls grades out of nowhere!! Come on  I had a A, A, B and B and made a B in the class and someone else had a A B+B C and they made an A. So  he pulls grades out of nowhere!! Not really recommended and he rufuses to bring your exams to class.. ONly four A's 21 B's  7 C's and    7 F's .. Class is very boring  and a waste of time!!
good teacher but pulls grades out of no where!!!!!!
Online class for geog 1101 was very straight forward.  Not hard at all, just do your discussions.

What a waste. Not helpful or clear at all. Online course had to write about each chapter and 5 one pg.essays on something. No clarity even when you ask him a question. No idea what grade is until class is over. Friend had him in class & said its was no clearer then. Avoid this like the plague
